titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Kurt Robert Mattusch Papers, 1919-1969
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1998 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Writings, correspondence, memoranda, reports, notes, printed matter, and maps, relating to economic conditions in Germany and the United States in the 1930s and 1940s, the postwar occupation of Germany, the transition of India to independence, postwar economic conditions in South Korea, and the New York City politician Raymond V. Ingersoll.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Kurt Robert Mattusch Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1981.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Economic Counsellor, U.S. State Department, American Consulate General, Berlin, Germany
Staff member of Civil Administration Division of U.S. Military Government in Germany, Berlin, Germany
Senior Analyst on India and South Asia, U.S. State Department, Washington, D.C.
Economic Counsellor, U.S. Operations Mission to Korea, Seoul, Korea
Director, Korean Economic Research Center, Seoul, Korea

scopecontent.p: Drafts and printed copies of articles, books, radio broadcasts, and speeches with correspondence, notes, posters, and reviews relating to them, arranged chronologically by date of publication or writing.
Handwritten and typewritten notes, arranged alphabetically by subject.

Charts, clippings, correspondence, maps, memoranda, notes, printed matter, proposals, reports, summaries of conferences and discussions, unpublished writings of others, arranged alphabetically by subject.
Charts, maps, summary of a conference, arranged alphabetically by form.

New Haven, Connecticut, Office of Tax Collector,1938 (2)
